The Global Default Value for \"Unmount Modules\" in App Profile, If Enabled, It will Remove All Module Modifications to the System for Apps that Don\'t have a Profile Set

Suspicious Superuser Configuration Configure Suspicious Superuser Module Settings Configuration Description This Feature Allows you to Customize the Uname Value and Build Time Spoofing, Enter the Values you want to Set and Click Apply to Take Effect Uname Value Build Time Spoofing Current Value: %s Current Build Time: %s Apply

KStat Configuration Add KStat Static Configuration File/Directory Path Hint: You can use "Default" to use the Original Value Add KStat Path Add Reset KStat Configuration Are you sure you want to Clear All KStat Configurations? This Action Cannot be Undone KStat Configuration Description • Add Suspicious KStat Statically: Static Stat Information of Files/directories • add_sus_kstat: Add Path before Bind Mount, Storing Original Stat Information • Update Suspicious KStat: Update Target Ino, Keep Size and Blocks Unchanged • update Suspicious KStat Full Clone: Update Ino Only, Keep other Original vmValues Static KStat Configuration KStat Path Management No KStat Configuration yet, Click the Button below to Add
Hide Suspicious Mounts for All Processes When Enabled, Suspicious Mounts will be Hidden from All Processes, Including KSU Processes When Disabled, Suspicious Mounts will only be Hidden from Non-KSU Processes, KSU Processes can See the Mounts
Backup Create a Backup of All Configurations, The Backup File will Include All Settings, Paths, and Configurations Create Backup Backup Created Successfully: %s Backup Creation Failed: %s Backup File not Found Invalid Backup File Format Backup Version Mismatch, But will Attempt to Restore Restore Restore Configurations from a Backup File, This will Overwrite All Current Settings Select Backup File Configuration Restored Successfully from Backup Created on %s from Device: %s Restore Failed: %s Confirm Restore This will Overwrite All Current Configurations, Are you sure you Want to Continue? Restore Backup Date: %s Device: %s Version: %s Lock State Overwrite Bootloader Locking Status Attribute in Late Start Service Mode Cleanup Residue Cleanup the Residual Files and Directories of Various Modules and Tools (May be deleted by mistake, resulting in loss and failure to start, use with caution) Edit Suspicious Path Edit Kstat Static Configuration Edit KStat Path Save Edit Delete Update Update Full Clone Application Path Other paths Other Add App Path Search Apps %1$d Apps Selected %1$d Apps already Added All Apps have been Added No Apps Found
Suspicious Loop Paths Add Suspicious Loop Path Edit Suspicious Loop Path No Suspicious Loop Paths Configured Reset Loop Paths Are you Sure you Want to Clear All Suspicuous Loop Paths? This Action Cannot be Undone Loop Path Note: Only Paths Not Inside /Storage/ and /SDCard/ Can be Added via Loop Paths Invalid Loop Path Failed to Add Loop Path Failed to Edit Loop Path Loop Paths Add Loop Path
Loop Path Configuration Loop Paths are Re-Flagged as Suspicious Path on Each Non-Root User App or Isolated Service Startup, This Helps Address Issues Where Added Paths may have Their Inode Status Reset or Inode Re-Created in the Kernel AVC Log Spoofing Disabled: Disable Spoofing Suspicious TContext of \'Su\' Shown in AVC Log in Kernel\nEnabled: Enable Spoofing Suspicious TContext of \'Su\' with \'Kernel\' Shown in AVC Log in Kernel
Suspicious Maps Library Path Add Suspicious Map Edit Suspicious Map No Suspicious Maps Configured Failed to Add Suspicioys Map Failed to edit SUS map Reset Suspicious Maps This will Remove All Configured Suspicious Maps, This Action Cannot be Undone Memory Map Hiding Hide Mapped Real File from Various Maps in /Proc/Self/ Hide the real file paths of memory mappings from /Proc/Self/[maps|smaps|smaps_rollup|map_files|mem|pagemap]. Please note: This Feature Does not Support Hiding Anonymous Memory Mappings, Nor can it Hide Inline Hooks or PLT Hooks Caused by the Injected Library Itself Important Notice: For applications with well-implemented injection detection mechanisms, this feature may not effectively bypass detection. First, Find the Target App\'s PID and UID using PS -Enf, then Check the Relevant Paths in /Proc/<Pid>/Maps and Compare the Device Numbers with Those in /Proc/1/MountInfo to Ensure Consistency, Only when the Device Numbers Match can the Map Hiding Function Work Properly Alternate Icon Change the Launcher Icon to KernelSU\'s Icon Refresh
